meanings.definition: A hot spring in which water intermittently boils, sending a tall column of water and steam into the air.
meanings.sent1: The geysers in Yellowstone National Park shoot up hot water high into the sky.
meanings.sent2: Visitors to the geysers were amazed by the powerful bursts of steam and water.
meanings.sent3: The geysers decided to show off their boiling skills during the park tour.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement bubbled up like a geyser when she won the race.
meanings.sent5: The geysers danced in the sunlight, creating a magical spectacle for onlookers.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that erupts suddenly and violently.
meanings.sent1: The volcano was like a geyser, erupting with great force and noise.
meanings.sent2: His temper was a geyser, exploding unexpectedly during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The popcorn machine at the cinema went crazy, behaving like a geyser of kernels.
meanings.sent4: Emotions can build up inside like a geyser, ready to burst at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The car engine roared to life, starting up like a geyser of power.
